0.text:
In Australia and around the world sister
city relationships have been promoting

4.text:
international understanding and
friendship since the early 1900s.

8.text:
Sister city relationships are
very important to the City of Adelaide

12.text:
In fact, we have five: Austin, Christchurch
Georgetown

17.text:
Himeji and Qingdao. Austin is the capital
of Texas in the United States. Austin has

24.text:
a diverse culture with many influences
from the South American, African American,

29.text: and European amongst others. Like Adelaide life in Austin is

33.text:
characterized by festivals and events
held throughout the year

37.text:
set amidst Park Lands and a beautiful
landscapes of desert blooms and amazing sunsets.

42.text:
Christchurch is the capital city
within the province of Canterbury, New Zealand.

47.text:
The similarities between Adelaide in
Christchurch have led to a prosperous

52.text:
relationship resulting in joint
commercial ventures as well

57.text:
as the exchange of goods and services
for commerce, the arts and innovation

62.text:
Georgetown is the capital of Penang in
Malaysia. Our sister city relationship has

69.text:
strong foundation through social,
economic and cultural ties. Penang

75.text:
was founded in 1786 by Captain Francis Light.
Fifty years later in 1836

82.text:
Adelaide was founded by his son 
Colonel William Light.

88.text:
Himeji is situated in the Hyōgo province, 
480 kilometers southwest of Tokyo in Japan. The city of

97.text:
Himeji and Adelaide have similar
reputations for cityscapes characterized

101.text: by beautiful heritage architecture. The Himeji Castle is the oldest wooden castle in

108.text:
Japan and was registered as a world
cultural heritage site in 1993 for

117.text:
Qingdao is a major city in eastern Shandong province in China... with a population of over 8
million people.

124.text:
Australians know the Chinese city best
for the Tsingtao beer - a one hundred and

128.text:
ten year old company that makes China's
top selling export lager. Tsingtao relies

134.text:
heavily on malting barley from South
Australia in its beer production. This

140.text:
newest sister city relationship is
expected to have a positive impact on

144.text: our trade relations for Shandong Province

147.text:
is the birthplace of Confucius. Some
people have asked why does Adelaide City

153.text:
Council get so actively involved in
international relations, partnerships and connections?

157.text: The answer to that is simple: As an economy, as a city, as a group of

165.text:
individuals who love our city our
prosperity is linked towards being more

169.text:
outward-looking and our relationship
with our sister cities is a doorway. It's

175.text:
an open door to opportunity the former
relationships we have through our sister

180.text:
cities can be leveraged mutual benefit
of Adelaide, South Australia and our sisters.

186.text:
For all of us it's important that we
play a leadership role so where did the opportunities lie?

193.text:
Well, we think they lie in a few key areas
for our city. Research and development,

198.text:
technology, innovation, education, tourism, food, 
culture and multiculturalism.

207.text:
These are the things we do extremely
well in the City of Adelaide. And there are many

211.text: businesses working already in these sectors.

215.text:
This is the City of Adelaide: 
An internationally connected city 
where ideas come to life
